meanings.definition: Failure to conform to established customs or rules.
meanings.sent1: The teacher noticed several nonconformities in the students' uniforms.
meanings.sent2: The company was fined for the nonconformities found during the inspection.
meanings.sent3: The nonconformities in the dress code led to a funny mix-up at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her nonconformities were like colorful dots in a sea of black and white.
meanings.sent5: The nonconformities in his artwork made it stand out from the rest.

meanings.definition: A person who does not conform to prevailing attitudes or behavior.
meanings.sent1: She was known as a nonconformities in the conservative community.
meanings.sent2: The nonconformities stood out in the crowd with their unique style.
meanings.sent3: The nonconformities at the party made everyone smile with their antics.
meanings.sent4: He was a nonconformities in a world of followers, blazing his own trail.
meanings.sent5: The nonconformities inspired others to embrace their individuality.

meanings.definition: The state or quality of not conforming.
meanings.sent1: The nonconformities of the new design raised eyebrows among the team.
meanings.sent2: The nonconformities of her beliefs challenged the status quo.
meanings.sent3: The nonconformities of the experiment resulted in unexpected outcomes.
meanings.sent4: The nonconformities of the landscape created a breathtaking view.
meanings.sent5: The nonconformities of his speech captured everyone's attention.
